thread.title: Man United: Antonio Valencia defies Jose Mourinho's orders after EFL Cup final win | Metro News
thread.title_full: Man United: Antonio Valencia defies Jose Mourinho's orders after EFL Cup final win | Metro News

author: Sean Kearns For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Man United: Antonio Valencia defies Jose Mourinho's orders after EFL Cup final win | Metro News

organizations.name: metro news search metro follow us antonio valencia

text:
Search Metro Follow us Antonio Valencia hits the gym despite being given two days off by Jose Mourinho after EFL Cup final win Sean Kearns for Metro.co.uk Monday 27 Feb 2017 4:17 pm Antonio Valencia has been one of United’s star performers this term (Picture: Getty) 
Jose Mourinho gave his Manchester United squad two days off after their dramatic 3-2 win against Southampton in the EFL Cup final – but not everyone got the message. 
The Red Devils looked dead on their feet in the dying stages of the clash at Wembley but Zlatan Ibrahimovic’s late header – his second of the game – gave Mourinho his first trophy at the club. Jurgen Klopp sends warning to his Liverpool flops after Leicester loss 
It was United’s fourth game in 11 days and Mourinho is keen to take full advantage of a rare week without a midweek fixture to give his players extra rest. 
Many members of the United squad took full advantage of the break on offer last night but Antonio Valencia clearly didn’t get the memo and uploaded a number of videos onto his Instagram today of him at the gym. Lo que pasó ayer ya es historia vamos a seguir trabajando fuerte. @manchesterunited A post shared by antoniovalencia2525 (@antoniovalencia2525) on Feb 27, 2017 at 4:48am PST 
The Ecuadorian was one of United’s better performers at Wembley and he’s clearly keen to keep his good form going by keeping up his fitness levels during time off.
